intro: Psychotria micayensis, commonly known as the Micayensis Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests. Psychotria micayensis is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal in botanical gardens.
